title.narrative: WASH

description.narrative: The proportion of people (men and women) that properly use water and sanitation infra-structures and adopte safe hygiene practices ie. hand washing, drinking water treatment and conservation and safe excreta disposal is increased by 20% in the target regions of Oio, Quinara, Tombali, Biombo, Gabu, Bissau and Cacheu by the end of 2015.

mailing-address.narrative: Predio das Naçoes Unidas Apartado 464 1034 Bissau Codex Bissau

sector.narrative: Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Sanitation in emergencies - improving sanitation services in communities
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The proportion of people (men and women) that properly use water and sanitation infra-structures and adopte safe hygiene practices; ie. hand washing, drinking water treatment and conservation and safe excreta disposal is increased by 20% in the target regions of Oio, Quinara, Tombali, Biombo, Gabu, Bissau and Cacheu by the end of 2015.
WASH sector policy documents elaborated, reviewed, approved and been implemented

baseline.value: 0 WASH sector policy documents reviewed or approved

target.value: 2015:2 policies documents (Water National Policy and Sanitation and Hygiene National Policy) elaborated and submited for the approval of the Governement

actual.value: 2015:2 policies documents drafted, expected validation workshop not realized.

title.narrative: Water supply systems, sanitation and hygiene facilities constructed / rehabilitated in 20 health centers, 11 Child-Friendly Schools and 3 Nutritional Recovery Center.

baseline.value: 0 interventions in Health Centers, Child-Friendly Schools and Nutritional Recovery Center

target.value: 2015:Interventions in 20 Health Centers, 11 Child-Frindly Schools and 3 Nutritional Recovery Center

actual.value: 2015:Interventions in 10 health centers (in Gabú, Quinara and Tombali) 12 child-friendly schools and 2 Nutritional Recovery Center (1970 pregnant, 1010 child's, 405 companions)

title.narrative: 74 water points constructed or rehabilitated for schools or communities

baseline.value: 106 water points constructed and rehabilitated in communities and schools, benefiting about 16,800 people in the regions of Quinara and Tombali

target.value: 2014:75 water points constructed/rehabilitated in schools and communities benefitting17,900 poeple

actual.value: 2015:78 water points constructed or rehabilitated and water quality confirmed benefiting 16,800 inhabitants and pupils, 5 water supply systems upgraded to photovoltaic systems

title.narrative: Special events related to the sector celebrated as well as WASH cluster monthly meetings held to enhance awareness and coordination strengthening among key actors

baseline.value: 2 events and 9 WASH cluster meeting held

actual.value: 2015:2 events (WWD and WTD) and 10 WASH cluster meetings held

title.narrative: 15,000 families in the regions of Oio, Gabu, Quinara, Tombali, Biombo, Cacheu and Bissau sensitized about hand washing, HWT&S and correct elimination of excreta.

baseline.value: 27.235 families sensitized about hand washing, HWT&S and correct elimination of excreta

target.value: 2014:More than 170,000 families sensitized (December 2014, also as part of Ebola and cholera prevention)

actual.value: 2015:More than 170,000 families sensitized also as part of Ebola prevention campaign

title.narrative: 25,000 families, 200 villages, 100 schools and 3 centers for nutritional rehabilitation mobilized to adopt three key hygiene practices: i) hand washing with soap or ash, ii) elimination of open defecation and iii) processing and safe storage of water consumption.

target.value: 2015:25.0000 families mobilizade with special focus on pregnants, mothers and child facing nutrional issues

actual.value: 2015:Around 42,500 families mobilized through campaigns in communities, neighborhoods, schools, hospital and markets. Regular sensitization held 2 times in a week in the center for nutritional recovery during 9 months.

title.narrative: CLTS implemented in 150 small villages of the regions of Oio, Gabu, Quinara, Tombali, Biombo, Cacheu and Bissau and 2,750 family latrines constructed, 100 communities declared ODF

baseline.value: 355 communities declared ODF and 5,378 latrines constructed

target.value: 2014:An additional 255 communities ODF and more then 3,000 traditional latrines constructed

actual.value: 2015:208 communities declared ODF, 5,548 traditional latrines were constructed out of them 2,349 latrines were upgraded to improved

title.narrative: 15,500 new people provided with access to safe drinking water nationwide.

target.value: 2015:100 new water points will be construted/rehabilitated in Quinara and Tombali regions

actual.value: 2015:146 water supply infrastructures constructed or rehabilitated. 18.082 new people provided with acces to safe drinking water
